intro: Callista lonchophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many other daisies and related species. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Callista lonchophylla is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
